snippet: The rule, which will take effect Sept. 1, requires that all clinics providing abortions at any stage of pregnancy meet the costly building standards of ambulatory surgery centers.
abstract: Health clinics offering abortions in Texas file a federal lawsuit to block a new state rule that could shut down more than half of the state's remaining providers, forcing women seeking an abortion in southern and western Texas to drive several hundred miles each way or go out of state.
lead_paragraph: The rule, which will take effect Sept. 1, requires that all clinics providing abortions at any stage of pregnancy meet the costly building standards of ambulatory surgery centers.

headline.main: Abortion Providers in Texas Sue Over a Restrictive Rule That Could Close Clinics
headline.print_headline: Abortion Providers in Texas Sue Over a Restrictive Rule That Could Close Clinics
